alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 04 at 8:18AM MDT until April 05 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...A Blizzard Warning is in until 6pm Tuesday. Winter Storm Warnings will remain in effect through 6am Wednesday. Additional accumulations of 4 to 8 inches expected. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 MPH. The snow will begin to taper off Tuesday night and Wednesday, but the gusty winds will continue through Wednesday creating blowing snow and reduced visibility. * WHERE...Converse County Lower Elevations. * WHEN...Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM MDT Tuesday. Winter Storm Warnings will remain in effect until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
